legal.cookiesHtml:
Last updated: [dd/mm/yyyy]

1) What cookies are

Cookies are small files a website may store on your device via your browser. Similar technologies include localStorage.

2) What this Site uses

2.1 Cookies

This Site does not use advertising/profiling cookies. Any essential/technical cookies, if present, may depend on the hosting provider or strictly necessary components.

2.2 localStorage (preferences)

The Site uses localStorage to store theme (light/dark), language (IT/EN) and the privacy/cookie choice. These preferences are not used for profiling and remain on your device.

2.3 Analytics (Umami self-hosted)

The Site uses Umami in a privacy-friendly, typically cookie-less configuration to produce aggregated/pseudonymised statistics and improve the Site.

3) Managing cookies and local data

You can delete cookies and local data (localStorage) via your browser settings or use private browsing. Disabling essential cookies may affect some functionality, if present.
legal.privacyHtml:
Last updated: [dd/mm/yyyy]

This notice explains how personal data is processed when you visit this website (“Site”).

1) Data Controller

Manuel Zambelli, Verona (Italy).
Contact: [PRIVACY_EMAIL]

2) Data we process

2.1 Usage statistics (Analytics)

The Site uses Umami Analytics (self-hosted) to understand traffic and improve content. Collected data is technical usage information (e.g. pages viewed, session duration, referrer, device/browser type, operating system).

Analytics is configured in a privacy-friendly way: no advertising profiling, no data selling and typically cookie-less (aggregated/pseudonymised statistics).

2.2 Contact data

If you submit the contact form, we process the data you provide (e.g. name, email, message) solely to reply and manage any follow-up communication.

If the form uses a third-party forwarding service (e.g. form-to-email), that provider may process data under its own terms and notices.

2.3 Preferences stored on your device

The Site stores certain preferences via localStorage (not cookies), such as light/dark theme, language (IT/EN) and the privacy/cookie choice. This information stays on your device and is not used to identify you.

3) Purposes & lawful bases

  • Analytics and Site improvement: legitimate interests (non-invasive, no profiling); alternatively, where required, consent.
  • Responding to enquiries: pre-contractual steps and/or consent depending on the request.
  • Security and technical operation: legitimate interests.

4) Recipients

Data may be processed by technical providers (hosting, email provider) and the self-hosted analytics system (Umami), only as necessary for the purposes above.

5) International transfers

If any provider processes data outside the EEA, appropriate GDPR safeguards will apply (e.g. SCCs or adequacy decisions).

6) Retention

  • Contact messages: kept for the time needed to handle the request and no longer than [RETENTION_CONTACT], unless legally required.
  • Analytics: stored according to Umami self-hosted settings, ideally for [RETENTION_ANALYTICS].

7) Your rights

You can exercise GDPR rights by contacting [PRIVACY_EMAIL]. You may also lodge a complaint with the relevant supervisory authority.

8) Changes

We may update this notice. The update date is shown at the top.

Copyright & intellectual property

All content on this website (text, graphics, layout, images and code) is protected by copyright and/or other intellectual property laws. Cloning, copying, reproducing, modifying or redistributing, in whole or in part, is prohibited without written permission. Any exceptions are allowed only for people expressly authorized by me.
